result.markdown:
# Exploring alpha




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mdl_alpha <- psych::alpha(item_responses)
print(summary(mdl_alpha))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

Reliability analysis   
 raw_alpha std.alpha G6(smc) average_r S/N    ase mean  sd median_r
      0.81      0.81    0.83      0.18 4.3 0.0048  0.6 0.2     0.16
NULL
```
:::
:::


**What happens to alpha if you only use half the scores?**

## From alpha to omega
<https://tidsskriftet.no/en/2022/08/medicine-and-numbers/internal-consistency-alpha-omega>


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mdl_omega <- psych::omega(item_responses)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Loading required namespace: GPArotation
```
:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning in fa.stats(r = r, f = f, phi = phi, n.obs = n.obs, np.obs = np.obs, :
The estimated weights for the factor scores are probably incorrect.  Try a
different factor score estimation method.
```
:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning in fac(r = r, nfactors = nfactors, n.obs = n.obs, rotate = rotate, : An
ultra-Heywood case was detected.  Examine the results carefully
```
:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning in cov2cor(t(w) %*% r %*% w): diag(.) had 0 or NA entries; non-finite
result is doubtful
```
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](ct-alpha_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
print(summary(mdl_omega))
```
